Black and Tan.ingredients: Pale ale or lager and stout or porter

Black Velvet.preparation: Mix equal parts stout and Champagne

Irish Car Bomb.standard drinkware: A pub glass and a shot glass.
Irish Car Bomb.preparation: The whiskey is floated on top of the Irish cream in a shot glass, and the shot glass is then dropped into the stout

Sake Bomb.standard drinkware: A pint glass and a shot glass.
Sake Bomb.preparation: The shot of sake is dropped into the beer, causing it to fizz violently.  The drink should then be consumed immediately.
Sake Bomb.ingredients:
1 pint (~16 parts) beer
1 shot (1.5 parts) sake

Snakebite.preparation: Mix in a standard pint glass equal parts lager and cider
Snakebite.ingredients:
One part Lager
One part Cider

The Blenheim.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
The Blenheim.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Blow my Skull Off.standard drinkware:
1 pint rum
1 pint porter or ale
1/2 pint brandy
2 pints boiling water
lime or lemon juice to taste
sugar to taste

Brandy Alexander.preparation: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg.
Brandy Alexander.ingredients:
3 cl (1 part) Cognac
3 cl (1 part) Crème de cacao (brown)
3 cl (1 part) Fresh cream

Brandy Manhattan.preparation: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.
Brandy Manhattan.ingredients:
5 cL Rye whiskey
2 cL Sweet red vermouth
Dash Angostura bitters

Brandy Sour (Cyprus).served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Brandy Sour (Cyprus).preparation: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.
Brandy Sour (Cyprus).ingredients:
5 cl (two parts) Cyprus brandy
2.5 cl (one part) lemon squash
2–4 drops of bitters
Top with carbonated water

Chicago Cocktail.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Chicago Cocktail.preparation: "Chicago Cocktail". CocktailDB. Archived from the original on September 9, 2015.

French Connection.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
French Connection.timing: French Connection recipe at International Bartenders Association
French Connection.ingredients: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Horse's Neck.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Horse's Neck.preparation: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.
Horse's Neck.ingredients:
4 cL (1 part) Brandy
12 cL (3 parts) Ginger ale
Dash of Angostura bitter (optional)

Incredible Hulk.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Incredible Hulk.standard drinkware:
One part hpnotiq
One part cognac
Incredible Hulk.ingredients: Stir together and serve over ice.

Jack Rose.preparation: Traditionally shaken into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.
Jack Rose.ingredients:
2 parts applejack
1 part lemon or lime juice
1/2 part grenadine

Paradise.preparation: Shake together over ice.  Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.
Paradise.ingredients:
3.5 cl (7 parts) gin
2 cl (4 parts) apricot brandy
1.5 cl (3 parts) orange juice

Pisco Sour.preparation: Vigorously shake contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then strain into a glass and garnish with bitters.[1]
Pisco Sour.ingredients:
60ml Pisco
30ml lime juice
20ml simple syrup
1 egg white
Several drops of aromatic bitters at the end

Porto flip.preparation: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice.  Strain into glass, garnish and serve
Porto flip.ingredients:
1.5 cl (3 parts) brandy
4.5 cl (9 parts) port
1 cl (2 parts) egg yolk

Savoy Affair.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Savoy Affair.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Savoy Corpse Reviver.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Savoy Corpse Reviver.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Sazerac.preparation: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.[1]
Sazerac.ingredients:
5 cl cognac
1 cl absinthe
One sugar cube
Two dashes Peychaud's Bitters

Sidecar.preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.
Sidecar.ingredients:
5 cl cognac
2 cl triple sec
2 cl lemon juice

Singapore Sling.preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass or tumbler. Optionally add one or two ice cubes circa 2 cl - do not flood the drink with ice. Garnish with lemon slice and cocktail cherry.
Singapore Sling.ingredients:
2.5 cl gin
4.5 cl cherry liqueur (cherry brandy)
1.5 cl fresh lemon juice
20 cl soda water

Stinger.preparation: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass.  May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.
Stinger.ingredients:
5 cL cognac
2 cL white crème de menthe

Tom and Jerry.served: Hot in a mug or bowl
Tom and Jerry.preparation: Separate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff. Mix egg yolks with powdered sugar. Put a spoonful of yolk mixture in cup, and mix with brandy and rum. Fold in some egg white, then add hot milk and top with more egg white. Stir gently to fold in the egg white. Top with Nutmeg.
Tom and Jerry.ingredients: eggs or egg whites, powdered sugar, brandy, rum

Caipirinha.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Caipirinha.preparation: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cachaça.
Caipirinha.ingredients:
5 cl cachaça
Half a lime cut into 4 wedges
2 teaspoons sugar

Alexander.preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
Alexander.ingredients:
3 cl cognac
3 cl brown crème de cacao
3 cl light cream

Angel Face.preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Angel Face.ingredients:
3 cl gin
3 cl Apricot brandy
3 cl Calvados

Aviation.preparation: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Aviation.ingredients:
45 ml gin
15 ml lemon juice
15 ml maraschino liqueur

Bee's Knees.preparation: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass
Bee's Knees.ingredients:
2 oz gin
3/4 oz lemon juice
3/4 oz honey

Bijou.preparation: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain
Bijou.ingredients:
1 part gin
1 part green Chartreuse
1 part sweet vermouth
Dash orange bitters

Blackthorn.standard drinkware:
2 oz sloe gin or 2 oz Irish whiskey
1 oz sweet vermouth
dash Angostura bitters
Blackthorn.preparation: A single dash of Absinth can be added for a more defined cocktail.[2]
Blackthorn.ingredients: Fill mixing glass with gin, vermouth, and bitters. Add ice and stir until chilled, then add strain into a chilled glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.[1]

Bramble.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Bramble.preparation: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.
Bramble.ingredients:
5 cl gin
2.5 cl lemon juice
1.25 cl simple syrup
1.5 cl Creme de Mure (blackberry liqueur)

Breakfast martini.standard drinkware: 2 shots (50 ml) gin3/4 shot (18.75 ml) Cointreau or triple sec3/4 shot fresh lemon juice1 spoon orange marmalade
Breakfast martini.ingredients: Mix or shake in cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Strain into glass and serve.

Bronx.preparation: Pour into cocktail shaker all ingredients with ice cubes, shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail or martini glass.
Bronx.ingredients:
3 cl (6 parts) Gin
1.5 cl (3 parts) Sweet Red Vermouth
1 cl (2 parts) Dry Vermouth
1.5 cl (3 parts) Orange juice

Casino.preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.
Casino.ingredients:
4 cl gin (Old Tom)
1 cl Maraschino
1 cl fresh lemon juice
2 dashes orange bitters

Cloister.standard drinkware:
1.5 oz gin (6 parts)
2 tsp grapefruit juice (2 parts)
1 tsp lemon juice (1 part)
1 tsp yellow chartreuse (1 part)[1]
Cloister.preparation:
0.5 tsp of simple sugar solution or superfine sugar can added for a sweeter cocktail. The Cloister is normally made using dry gin. The cocktail can be served off the rocks, with no ice in the glass. This recipe, more suited to a larger cocktail glass, calls for:
1.5 oz gin (6 parts)
0.5 oz grapefruit juice (2.5 parts)
0.25 oz lemon juice (1 part)
0.5 oz yellow chartreuse (1 part)
Cloister.ingredients: Combine ingredients with ice in cocktail shaker; shake well, then strain into cocktail glass, pouring over ice.

Clover Club Cocktail.preparation: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.
Clover Club Cocktail.ingredients:
4.5cl Gin
1.5cl lemon juice
1.5cl raspberry syrup
1 egg white

Cooperstown Cocktail.standard drinkware:
1 oz. Gin
.5 oz. Dry vermouth
.5 oz. Sweet vermouth
Mint sprig
Cooperstown Cocktail.ingredients: Shake with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass, add mint.

Damn the Weather.preparation: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass
Damn the Weather.ingredients:
1 measure gin
1/2 measure sweet vermouth
1/2 measure orange juice
1/4 measure orange curacao or triple sec

French 75.preparation: Combine gin, syrup, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice.  Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass.  Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.
French 75.ingredients:
3 cl gin
2 dashes simple syrup
1.5 cl lemon juice
6 cl Champagne

Derby.preparation: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.
Derby.ingredients:
6 cl gin
2 dashes peach bitters
2 fresh mint leaves

Gibson.preparation: Stir well in a shaker with ice, then strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish and serve
Gibson.ingredients:
6 cl (2 ounces) (6 parts) gin
1 cl (0.33 ounce) (1 part) dry vermouth

Gimlet.preparation: Mix and serve. Garnish with a slice of lime
Gimlet.ingredients:
Two parts gin
One part sweetened lime juice

Gin and tonic.served: Poured over ice cubes (on the rocks)
Gin and tonic.standard garnish: A slice or wedge of lime
Gin and tonic.preparation: In a glass filled with ice cubes, add gin and tonic.
Gin and tonic.ingredients: Gin and tonic water, according to taste

Greyhound.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Greyhound.preparation: Mix gin and juice, pour over ice in Old Fashioned glass
Greyhound.ingredients:
5 cl (1 parts) Gin
20 cl (4 parts) Grapefruit juice

John Collins.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
John Collins.preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.
John Collins.ingredients:
4.5 cl (3 parts) gin
3 cl (2 parts) freshly squeezed lemon juice
1.5 cl (1 part) sugar syrup
6 cl (4 parts) carbonated water

The Last Word.preparation: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.
The Last Word.ingredients:
One part gin
One part lime juice
One part green Chartreuse
One part maraschino liqueur

Lime Rickey.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Lime Rickey.preparation: Combine spirit, lime and shell in a highball or wine glass. Add ice, stir and then add sparkling mineral water.
Lime Rickey.ingredients:
2oz bourbon, rye whiskey, or gin
Half of a lime squeezed and dropped in the glass
Sparkling mineral water

Long Island Iced Tea.primary alcohol by volume:
Gin
Tequila
Vodka
Rum
Triple sec
Long Island Iced Tea.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Long Island Iced Tea.preparation: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Optionally garnish with lemon slice. [1]
Long Island Iced Tea.ingredients:
1.5 cl  Tequila
1.5 cl  Vodka
1.5 cl  White rum
1.5 cl  Triple sec
1.5 cl  Gin
2.5 cl  Lemon juice
3.0 cl  simple syrup
Top with Cola

Lorraine.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Lorraine.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Martini.preparation: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.
Martini.ingredients:
6 cl (6 parts) gin
1 cl (1 parts) dry vermouth

Mickey Slim.primary alcohol by volume:
One part gin
A pinch of DDT
Mickey Slim.preparation: DDT is not very soluble in gin so only a small quantity will dissolve.  DDT has been linked to numerous health problems in humans.[1]
Mickey Slim.ingredients: Stir the DDT into the gin and serve

Monkey Gland.preparation: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Monkey Gland.ingredients:
5cl gin
3cl orange juice
2 drops absinthe
2 drops grenadine

My Fair Lady.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
My Fair Lady.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Negroni.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Negroni.preparation: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.
Negroni.ingredients:
3 cl gin
3 cl sweet red vermouth
3 cl Campari

Old Etonian.standard drinkware:
1.5 oz. gin
1.5 oz. Kina Lillet or Cocchi Americano
2 dashes Orange bitters
2 dashes Crème de Noyaux
Old Etonian.ingredients: Shake with ice and strain into a stemmed cocktail glass.

Pegu.standard drinkware:
1 1/2 ounces gin[1]
3/4 ounce orange curaçao
1 teaspoon lime juice
Dash bitters
Dash orange bitters
Pegu.ingredients: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with crushed ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

Pink Gin.standard drinkware:
One part Plymouth gin
One Part Water
Dash of Angostura Bitters (adjust to taste)
Pink Gin.preparation: The traditional garnish is a shave of lemon rind. You can obtain this by removing about an inch strip of lemon rind with a potato peeler.
Pink Gin.ingredients: Chill the glass, then coat the inside with the Bitters.  Add the gin very well chilled, garnish and serve.

Pink Lady.preparation: Shake ingredients very well with ice and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Pink Lady.ingredients:
1.5 oz. gin
4 dashes grenadine
1 egg white

Royal Arrival.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Royal Arrival.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Salty Dog.preparation: Shake gin and grapefruit juice in cocktail shaker. Strain into a salt-rimmed highball glass.
Salty Dog.ingredients:
4 cl gin or vodka
10 cl grapefruit juice

Suffering Bastard.preparation: Shake everything but ginger beer with ice, then stir & pour unstrained
Suffering Bastard.ingredients:
1 ounce gin
1 ounce brandy (or bourbon)
1/2 ounce lime juice cordial
2 dashes Angostura bitters
4 ounces ginger beer, chilled

Tom Collins.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Tom Collins.preparation: Mix the gin, lemon juice and sugar syrup in a tall glass with ice, top up with soda water, garnish and serve.
Tom Collins.ingredients:
4.5 cL (3 parts) Old Tom Gin
3 cL (2 parts) freshly squeezed lemon juice
1.5 cL (1 part) sugar syrup
6 cL (4 parts) carbonated water to taste

Tuxedo.standard drinkware:
3 cl gin (Old Tom)
3 cl dry Vermouth
1/2 barspoon Maraschino
1/4 barspoon Absinthe
3 dashes orange bitters
Tuxedo.timing: Tuxedo recipe at International Bartenders Association
Tuxedo.ingredients: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.  Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

Vesper Martini.preparation: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the garnish.
Vesper Martini.ingredients:
6 cl gin
1.5 cl vodka
0.75 cl Lillet Blanc

Wolfram.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Wolfram.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Ouzini.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Ouzini.standard drinkware:
2.5 cl (one part) Cyprus ouzo
7.5 cl (three parts) fresh orange juice
2.5 cl (one part) fresh lemon juice
2-4 drops of bitters
Ouzini.ingredients: Shake ouzo and fresh juices vigorously together, coat the rim of a glass with powdered sugar and pour drink into glass over ice, and add dash of bitters. Garnish with a thin orange slice and serve.

Bacardi.preparation: Shake together with ice.  Strain into glass and serve
Bacardi.ingredients:
4.5 cl white rum
2 cl lime juice
1 cl grenadine syrup

Between the Sheets.preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Between the Sheets.ingredients:
3 cl white rum
3 cl cognac
3 cl triple sec
2 cl fresh lemon juice

Blue Hawaii.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Blue Hawaii.standard garnish: pineapple or orange quarter slice, maraschino cherry
Blue Hawaii.preparation: Combine all ingredients with ice, stir or shake, then pour into a hurricane glass with the ice. For garnish score pineapple or orange slice with a knife and insert onto rim of glass; optionally use toothpick or cocktail umbrella to spear maraschino cherry through center and attach to top of fruit slice; otherwise float cherry on top of ice!
Blue Hawaii.ingredients:
2 cl light rum
2 cl vodka
1.5 cl  Blue Curaçao
9 cl pineapple juice, unsweetened
3 cl Sour mix

Brass Monkey.type: On the rocks; poured over ice
Brass Monkey.standard drinkware:
One part dark rum
One part vodka
One part orange juice
Brass Monkey.ingredients: Stir together and serve over ice.

Bumbo.standard drinkware:
2 ounces rum
1 ounce water
2 sugar cubes
Sprinkle ​1⁄4 teaspoon to taste cinnamon
Sprinkle ​1⁄4 teaspoon to taste nutmeg

Bushwacker.preparation: Blend all the ingredients together in a blender, including the ice, and then strain into a hurricane glass. Place cherry on top of the drink as a garnish and serve. Whipped cream can also be added as a garnish to the top of the drink before the cherry.[1]
Bushwacker.ingredients:
1 ounce Dark Rum
1 ounce Kahlúa
1 ounce Dark Crème de Cacao
2 ounces Cream of Coconut
2 ounces Milk or Half & Half
1 cup ice

Cobra's Fang.standard drinkware:
1/2 oz Demerera 151 rum
1/2 oz Jamaican dark rum
1/4 oz Fassionola syrup
1/2 oz Falernum syrup
1/2 oz Orange juice
1/2 oz Lime Juice
Dash each bitters & grenadine

Cojito.primary alcohol by volume: straight up in a cocktail glass
Cojito.standard drinkware:
15ml of white rum
5ml Malibu
5ml lime juice
Mint leaves
1 sprig of mint
Cojito.ingredients: In a shaker add white rum, Malibu, lime juice, some mint leaves and crushed ice, garnish with the sprig of mint.

Cremat.served:
dark rum
sugar
lemon peel
cinnamon
coffee beans
Cremat.ingredients: Mix all ingredients in a pot, heat, then set aflame. Put out when about 1/3 of the drink has burned away. Serve hot in coffee mugs or glasses.

Cuba Libre.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Cuba Libre.preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.
Cuba Libre.ingredients:
12 cl Cola
5 cl white rum
1 cl Fresh lime juice

Cuban Sunset.type: on the rocks, poured over ice
Cuban Sunset.standard drinkware:
4.5 cl (3 parts) rum (preferably white rum)
9 cl (6 parts) carbonated lime soda
4 cl (2 parts) lemonade
4 cl (2 parts) guava nectar
2 cl (1.5 parts) grenadine syrup
Garnish with lemon slice
Cuban Sunset.preparation: Lemonade or lime soda can be replaced with non-carbonated beverages based on preference. The traditional Cuban version of the cocktail does not include grenadine, replacing it with an equivalent amount (2 cl, 1.5 parts) of extra guava nectar. Guava nectar can be replaced with boiled-down guava juice thickened with sugar for a more watery cocktail.[1]
Cuban Sunset.ingredients: Fill highball (tall) glass with ice. Mix lime soda, lemonade, guava nectar, and grenadine syrup together to form a mixture. Pour rum into glasses over ice, then evenly layer the guava mixture over the rum. Mix as desired. Garnish with a half-slice of lemon.[1]

Daiquiri.preparation: In a cocktail shaker add all ingredients. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Daiquiri.ingredients:
6 cl white rum
2 cl lime juice
2 bar spoons superfine sugar

Dark 'N' Stormy.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Dark 'N' Stormy.preparation: Fill glass with ice, add rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.
Dark 'N' Stormy.ingredients:
6 cl dark rum
10 cl ginger beer

El Presidente.preparation: Stir well with ice, then strain into glass.  Garnish and serve.
El Presidente.ingredients:
Two parts rum
One part curaçao
One part blanc vermouth
Dash grenadine

Flaming Doctor Pepper.preparation:
1 pint (~13 parts) beer
3 parts Amaretto
1 part high-proof liquor
Flaming Doctor Pepper.ingredients: A pub glass and a shot glass.

Flaming volcano.standard garnish: pineapple and/or orange quarter slices, maraschino cherries
Flaming volcano.preparation: Combine ingredients except overproof rum with 2 scoops of crushed ice in a blender. Pour, and place small amount of overproof rum into volcano and carefully light.
Flaming volcano.ingredients:
1 US fluid ounce (30 ml) light rum
1 oz. brandy
1 oz. overproof rum
4 US fluid ounces (120 ml) orange juice
2 US fluid ounces (60 ml) lemon juice, unsweetened
2 oz. orgeat syrup

Gunfire.standard drinkware: 1 cup of black tea1 shot of rum
Gunfire.ingredients: Pour the tea into a cup. Pour the rum in and stir.

Hot buttered rum.ingredients: Rum, butter, hot water or cider, sweetener and spices

Hurricane.preparation: Shake ingredients with ice, then pour into the glass and serve over ice.
Hurricane.ingredients:
One part dark rum
One part white rum
Half part over proofed rum
Passion fruit syrup
Lemon juice

Macu\u00e1.standard drinkware:
2 parts white rum (preferably Flor de Caña)
2 parts guava juice
1 part lemon juice
sugar to taste
Macu\u00e1.ingredients: Blend the ingredients with 1 cup of ice and serve well chilled. Garnish with an orange slice

Mai Tai.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Mai Tai.preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.
Mai Tai.ingredients:
4 cl white rum
2 cl dark rum
1.5 cl orange curaçao
1.5 cl orgeat syrup
1 cl fresh lime juice

Mojito.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Mojito.standard garnish: sprig of mint (Yerba buena in the original recipe), slice of lime
Mojito.preparation: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish with sprig of mint leaves and lemon slice. Serve with straw.
Mojito.ingredients:
4 cl white rum
3 cl fresh lime juice
6 sprigs of mint
2 teaspoons sugar (or 2 cl of sugar syrup)
soda water

Mr. Bali Hai.standard drinkware:
1 1/2 oz of dark Jamaican rum
1 oz light Puerto Rican rum
3/4 oz coffee flavored brandy
1 1/2 oz pineapple juice (unsweetened)
1 oz lemon juice
1/2 oz of sugar syrup

Painkiller.ingredients:
1-4 part(s) Pusser's Rum
4 parts pineapple juice
1 part cream of coconut
1 part orange juice
Sprinkle with nutmeg

Pi\u00f1a colada.preparation: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender, pour into a large goblet or Hurricane glass and serve.
Pi\u00f1a colada.ingredients:
2 oz. white rum
1 oz. Coco Lopez cream of coconut
1 oz. coconut milk
6 oz. pineapple juice
1/2 cup crushed ice

Planter's Punch.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Planter's Punch.preparation: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add dash Angostura bitters. Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.
Planter's Punch.ingredients:
4.5cl Dark rum
3.5 cl fresh orange juice
3.5 cl fresh pineapple juice
2 cl fresh lemon juice
1 cl Grenadine syrup
1 cl simple syrup
3 or 4 dashes Angostura bitters

Rum Swizzle.type: On the rocks; poured over ice
Rum Swizzle.standard drinkware:
4oz. black rum
4oz. gold rum
Juice of 2 lemons
5oz. pineapple juice
5oz orange juice
2oz. Bermuda falernum
6 dashes Angostura Bitters
Rum Swizzle.ingredients: Mix in pitcher with crushed ice, shake vigorously until a frothing head appears. Strain into cocktail glasses. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry. Serves 6.

Yellow Bird.standard drinkware:
3 cl White Rum
1.5 cl Galliano
1.5 cl Triple sec
1.5 cl Lime juice
Yellow Bird.timing: Yellow Bird recipe at International Bartenders Association
Yellow Bird.ingredients: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Zombie.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Zombie.standard drinkware:
Zombie glass
1 1/2 oz  Puerto Rican golden rum
1 1/2 oz Jamaican rum
1 oz demerara 151 rum
1/2 oz Donn's Mix (2:1 mix of grapefruit juice & cinnamon syrup)
1/2 oz velvet falernum
3/4 oz  lime juice
1/4 oz grenadine
2 dashes absinthe
1 dash angostura bitters
Zombie.preparation: Mix ingredients in a shaker with ice.  Pour into tiki mug filled with crushed ice.

Ginza Mary.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Ginza Mary.preparation: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.
Ginza Mary.ingredients:
4.5 cl/1 jigger (3 parts) vodka
9 cl/3 oz (6 parts) Tomato juice
1.5 cl/1 tbsp (1 part) Lemon juice
2 to 3 dashes of Worcestershire Sauce
Tabasco sauce
Celery salt
Black pepper

Tamagozake.served:
One raw egg (or egg yolk only)
3/4 cup (200 cc) sake
Honey or sugar to taste
Tamagozake.preparation: An alternative preparation method is to heat the sake/egg/honey mixture together, while whisking occasionally.Be careful to stop cooking before it turns into scrambled eggs.
Tamagozake.ingredients: Whisk the raw egg yolk and honey/sugar into 3/4 cup hot sake (hot enough to lightly cook the egg – 1:30 in the microwave).

Adios Motherfucker.primary alcohol by volume:
Gin
Tequila
Vodka
Rum
Triple sec
Adios Motherfucker.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Adios Motherfucker.preparation: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Optionally garnish with lemon slice. [1]
Adios Motherfucker.ingredients:
1.5 cl  Tequila
1.5 cl  Vodka
1.5 cl  White rum
1.5 cl  Triple sec
1.5 cl  Gin
2.5 cl  Lemon juice
3.0 cl  simple syrup
Top with Cola

Chimay\u00f3 Cocktail.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Chimay\u00f3 Cocktail.preparation: Pour the tequila and unfiltered apple cider into glass over ice.  Add the lemon juice and creme de cassis and stir.  Garnish and serve.
Chimay\u00f3 Cocktail.ingredients:
1½ oz Tequila
1 oz apple cider
1/4 oz lemon juice
1/4 oz creme de cassis

Juan Collins.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Juan Collins.preparation: Mix the gin, lemon juice and sugar syrup in a tall glass with ice, top up with soda water, garnish and serve.
Juan Collins.ingredients:
4.5 cL (3 parts) Old Tom Gin
3 cL (2 parts) freshly squeezed lemon juice
1.5 cL (1 part) sugar syrup
6 cL (4 parts) carbonated water to taste

Margarita.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Margarita.preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass rimmed with salt.
Margarita.ingredients:
5 cL (10 parts) Tequila
2 cL (4 parts) Triple sec
1.5 cL (3 parts) Lime juice

Mojito Blanco.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Mojito Blanco.standard garnish: sprig of mint (Yerba buena in the original recipe), slice of lime
Mojito Blanco.preparation: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish with sprig of mint leaves and lemon slice. Serve with straw.
Mojito Blanco.ingredients:
4 cl white rum
3 cl fresh lime juice
6 sprigs of mint
2 teaspoons sugar (or 2 cl of sugar syrup)
soda water

Matador.preparation: Mix the ingredients in a shaker half full of ice.  Strain and serve in a chilled cocktail glass or champagne flute.
Matador.ingredients:
1 to 1.5 parts silver or blanco tequila
2 to 3 parts pineapple juice
Juice of half a lime

Paloma.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Paloma.preparation: Stir together and serve over ice.
Paloma.ingredients:
One part tequila
Three parts grapefruit soda

Tequila Slammer.standard drinkware:
One part tequila
One part 7 Up, ginger ale, Sprite, or Mountain Dew
Tequila Slammer.preparation: Variation — If champagne is used instead of soda pop, the drink is known as a Slammer Royale[1]
Tequila Slammer.ingredients: Mix carefully to avoid releasing the dissolved CO2.

Tequila Sunrise.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Tequila Sunrise.preparation: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice.  Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom.  Stir gently to create the sunrise effect.  Garnish and serve.
Tequila Sunrise.ingredients:
4.5 cl (3 parts) Tequila
9 cl (6 parts) Orange juice
1.5 cl (1 part) Grenadine syrup

Tommy's Margarita.preparation: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Tommy's Margarita.ingredients:
4.5 cl Tequila
1.5 cl Freshly squeezed lime juice
2 bar spoons of agave nectar

Vampiro.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Vampiro.standard garnish: Salt on the rim. Chili pepper (optional)
Vampiro.preparation: Pour ingredients into glass rimmed with salt. Stir.
Vampiro.ingredients:
5 cl tequila
7 cl tomato juice
3 cl fresh orange juice
1 cl fresh lime juice
1 teaspoon clear honey
Half slice onion finely chopped
Few slices fresh red hot chili pepper
Few drops of Worcestershire Sauce
Salt

Agent Orange.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Agent Orange.standard drinkware:
5 cl (1 part) vodka
15 cl (3 parts) carrot juice
Agent Orange.ingredients: Mix in an old fashioned glass with ice and serve.

Apple Martini.preparation: Mix in a shaker, then pour into a chilled glass.  Garnish and serve.
Apple Martini.ingredients:
4.5 cl (3 parts) Vodka
1.5 cl (1 part) Apple schnapps / Calvados
1.5 cl (1 part) Cointreau

Astro pop.served: Vodka, blue curaçao, grenadine, sweet and sour mix and others
Astro pop.ingredients: Some versions are served as a cocktail or shooter

Black Russian.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Black Russian.preparation: Pour the ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Bloody Mary.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Bloody Mary.preparation: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.
Bloody Mary.ingredients:
4.5 cl/1 jigger (3 parts) vodka
9 cl/3 oz (6 parts) Tomato juice
1.5 cl/1 tbsp (1 part) Lemon juice
2 to 3 dashes of Worcestershire Sauce
Tabasco sauce
Celery salt
Black pepper

BLT cocktail.ingredients: BaconLettuce or LiquorTomatoVodka or Bacon vodka

Blue Lagoon.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Blue Lagoon.standard garnish: lemon slice or Garnish the brim with an orange slice
Blue Lagoon.preparation: pour vodka and blue curacao in a shaker with ice, shake well & strain into ice filled highball glass, top with lemonade, or lemon juice, garnish and serve.
Blue Lagoon.ingredients:
50 ml Vodka
20 ml Blue Curacao
100 ml Lemonade
1 orange slice.
Ice cubes

Bull Shot.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Bull Shot.preparation: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.
Bull Shot.ingredients:
4.5 cl/1 jigger (3 parts) vodka
9 cl/3 oz (6 parts) Tomato juice
1.5 cl/1 tbsp (1 part) Lemon juice
2 to 3 dashes of Worcestershire Sauce
Tabasco sauce
Celery salt
Black pepper

Caesar.standard garnish: stalk of celery and wedge of lime
Caesar.preparation: Rim glass with celery salt, and a lime wedge.
Caesar.ingredients:
6 oz. Clamato Juice
1–1½ oz. vodka
2 dashes hot sauce
4 dashes Worcestershire sauce
Celery salt
Freshly ground pepper
Lime wedge
1 crisp celery stalk

Cape Cod.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Cape Cod.preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Chi-Chi.preparation: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender, pour into a large goblet or Hurricane glass and serve.
Chi-Chi.ingredients:
2 oz. white rum
1 oz. Coco Lopez cream of coconut
1 oz. coconut milk
6 oz. pineapple juice
1/2 cup crushed ice

Colombia.preparation: Shake the vodka and citrus juices in a mixer, then strain into the glass.  Slide the grenadine down one side of the glass, where it will sink to the bottom.  Slide the curacao down the other side, to lie between the vodka and grenadine, and serve before the layers have a chance to mix.
Colombia.ingredients:
2 parts vodka or brandy[1]
1 part blue Curaçao
1 part grenadine
1 part lemon juice
6 parts orange juice

Cosmopolitan.preparation: Shake all ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime slice.
Cosmopolitan.ingredients:
4 cl Vodka Citron
1.5 cl Cointreau
1.5 cl Fresh lime juice
3 cl Cranberry juice

Espresso Martini.preparation: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass.
Espresso Martini.ingredients:
5 cl vodka
3 cl Kahlúa
Sugar syrup (according to individual preference of sweetness)
1 short strong espresso

Fizzy apple cocktail.preparation: Combine all three ingredients into a chilled glass and serve with ice and garnish.
Fizzy apple cocktail.ingredients:
1 shot Apple Vodka
1/2 cup Apple Juice
1/2 cup Lemonade

Godmother.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Godmother.preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Harrogate Nights.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Harrogate Nights.standard drinkware:
2.5cl (1 part) Vodka
1.25cl (1/2 part) Archers (Peach Schnapps)
1.25cl (1/2 part) Malibu
2.5cl (1 part) Fresh Orange Juice
2.5cl (1 part) Fresh Pineapple Juice

dash of Fresh Cranberry Juice
Harrogate Nights.ingredients: Fill a Highball glass with ice then add a dash of cranberry juice. Add the rest of the ingredients to the Boston glass, shake and strain into the Highball glass. Garnish and serve.

Harvey Wallbanger.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Harvey Wallbanger.preparation: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top.  Garnish and serve.
Harvey Wallbanger.ingredients:
4.5 cl (3 parts) Vodka
1.5 cl (1 part) Galliano
9 cl (6 parts) fresh orange juice

Hi-fi.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Hi-fi.preparation: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.
Hi-fi.ingredients:
5 cl (1 part) vodka
10 cl (2 parts) orange juice

Kamikaze.preparation: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.
Kamikaze.ingredients:
3 cl vodka
3 cl triple sec
3 cl lime juice

Kensington Court Special.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Kensington Court Special.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Lemon Drop.preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with sugar rim around the glass.
Lemon Drop.ingredients:
3 cl vodka citron
2 cl triple sec
1.5 cl lemon juice

Link Up.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Link Up.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Moscow Mule.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Moscow Mule.preparation: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.
Moscow Mule.ingredients:
4.5 cl (9 parts) vodka
0.5 cl (1 part) lime juice
12 cl (24 parts) ginger beer

Orange Tundra.type:
Vodka
cream soda, coffee liqueur and orange juice
Orange Tundra.standard drinkware: vodka, Kahlúa, Creme Soda, and orange juice
Orange Tundra.ingredients: add vodka, cream soda, coffee liqueur then orange juice to a highball class

Red Russian.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Red Russian.standard drinkware:
1 part (1 oz, 3 cl) vodka
1 part (1 oz, 3 cl) Cherry Heering
Red Russian.preparation: "Red Russian". CocktailDB. Archived from the original on September 9, 2015.
Red Russian.ingredients: Pour vodka, then Cherry Heering over ice.

Screwdriver.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Screwdriver.preparation: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.
Screwdriver.ingredients:
5 cl (1 part) vodka
10 cl (2 parts) orange juice

Sea Breeze.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Sea Breeze.preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.
Sea Breeze.ingredients:
4 cl Vodka
12 cl Cranberry juice
3 cl Grapefruit juice

Sex on the Beach.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Sex on the Beach.preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.
Sex on the Beach.ingredients:
4 cl Vodka
2 cl Peach schnapps
4 cl Orange juice
4 cl grenadine

Vodka Martini.preparation: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.
Vodka Martini.ingredients:
6 cl (6 parts) vodka
1 cl (1 parts) dry vermouth

White Russian.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
White Russian.preparation: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka into an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Float fresh cream on top and stir slowly.
White Russian.ingredients:
5 cl (5 parts) Vodka
2 cl (2 parts) Coffee liqueur
3 cl (3 parts) fresh cream

Woo Woo.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Woo Woo.preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.
Woo Woo.ingredients:
2 parts (1 oz) Vodka
1 part (.5 oz) Peach Schnapps
4 parts (2 oz) Cranberry juice

Yorsh.primary alcohol by volume:
10 parts beer
1 part vodka (Ratio varies according to taste.)

Amber Moon.standard drinkware:
3 US fluid ounces (89 ml) whiskey or vodka
1 raw egg
Tabasco sauce, to taste
Amber Moon.preparation: This cocktail may also be blended
Amber Moon.ingredients: Crack an egg into a tall glass, leaving the yolk unbroken. Pour in whiskey. Add Tabasco to taste, or serve on the side.

Black Nail.type: On the rocks; poured over ice
Black Nail.standard drinkware:
2.5 cl Irish Whisky
2.5 cl Irish Mist
Black Nail.preparation: Traditionally a Black Nail uses blood red oranges for the fruit.
Black Nail.ingredients: Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes and then add the Irish whiskey and then Irish Mist. Stir gently.

Bobby Burns.preparation: Put all liquid ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Squeeze lemon peel on top. Shake, strain into glass.
Bobby Burns.ingredients:
4.5 cl Scotch whisky
4.5 cl red vermouth
3 dashes Bénédictine
Lemon peel

Boulevardier.preparation: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Boulevardier.ingredients:
45 ml (1.5 parts) bourbon or rye whiskey
30 ml (1 part) sweet red vermouth
30 ml (1 part) bitter campari

Bourbon Lancer.type: On the rocks; poured over ice
Bourbon Lancer.standard drinkware:
9 parts Bourbon
16 parts Champagne
3 dashes Angostura bitters
Bourbon Lancer.ingredients: Build over ice; stir. Garnish with twist of lemon peel.

Brooklyn.preparation: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.
Brooklyn.ingredients:
2 oz rye or Canadian whisky
1 oz dry vermouth
1/4 oz Maraschino liqueur
1/4 oz Picon or a few dashes of Angostura bitters
Maraschino cherry (Garnish)

Churchill.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Churchill.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Farnell.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Farnell.standard drinkware:
1 part Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey
3 parts lemonade
Ice
1 slice of lime
1 sprig of fresh mint
Farnell.ingredients: Pour Jack Daniel's into Collins glass filled with ice.  Fill to desired level with lemonade.  Stir lightly and garnish with lime and mint.

Irish coffee.preparation: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.
Irish coffee.ingredients:
4 cl (2 parts) Irish whiskey
8 cl (4 parts) hot coffee
3 cl (1½ parts) fresh cream
1 tsp brown sugar

Horsefeather.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Horsefeather.standard drinkware:
1.5 US fluid ounces (44 ml) rye whiskey or blended whiskey
4.0 US fluid ounces (120 ml) ginger beer
3 dashes Angostura bitters
squirt of lemon juice
Horsefeather.ingredients: Fill a highball glass 3/4 with ice. Pour in ingredients and stir.

Jack and Coke.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Jack and Coke.standard drinkware:
1 part Jack Daniel's Tennessee whiskey
3-5 parts Coca-Cola (strength dependent)
Ice
Jack and Coke.ingredients: Pour Jack Daniel's brand Tennessee whiskey into a Collins glass filled with ice. Fill to desired level with Coca-Cola. Stir lightly.

Lynchburg Lemonade.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Lynchburg Lemonade.preparation: Shake first 3 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. Top with the lemonade or lemon-lime. Add ice and stir. Garnish with lemon slices and cherries.[1]
Lynchburg Lemonade.ingredients:
1+1/4 oz Jack Daniel's
3/4 oz triple sec
2 oz sour mix
lemon-lime

Manhattan.preparation: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.
Manhattan.ingredients:
5 cL Rye whiskey
2 cL Sweet red vermouth
Dash Angostura bitters

Mint Julep.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Mint Julep.preparation: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.
Mint Julep.ingredients:
6 cL Bourbon whiskey
4 mint leaves
1 teaspoon powdered sugar
2 teaspoons water

Missouri Mule.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Missouri Mule.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Nixon.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Nixon.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Old Fashioned.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Old Fashioned.preparation: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.
Old Fashioned.ingredients:
45 ml Bourbon or Rye whiskey
2 dashes Angostura bitters
1 sugar cube
Few dashes plain water

Old Pal.standard drinkware:
One part Rye whiskey
One part dry Vermouth
One part Campari
Old Pal.ingredients: Mix the 3 ingredients in a mixing glass, and add ice.  Stir to chill, and strain into a cocktail glass

Rob Roy.served: Choice of "straight up" or "On the rocks"
Rob Roy.standard garnish: 2 Maraschino cherries on a skewer or lemon twist
Rob Roy.preparation: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up, or mixed in rocks glass, filled with ice.
Rob Roy.ingredients:
4.5 cl Scotch whisky
2.5 cl Sweet vermouth
Dash Angostura bitters

Rusty Nail.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Rusty Nail.preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish with a lemon twist. Serve.

Scotch and soda.preparation: Measure whisky into glass (with or without ice), top with water as desired

Seven and Seven.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Seven and Seven.preparation: Pour whiskey into Collins glass filled with ice.  Fill to desired level with 7 Up. Stir lightly.
Seven and Seven.ingredients:
1 shot Seagram's Seven Crown whiskey
6  fl. oz. 7 Up
Ice

Toronto.ingredients:
2 oz Canadian whisky
​1⁄4 oz Fernet-Branca
​1⁄4 tsp sugar
1 dash angostura bitters

Whiskey sour.served: On the rocks or straight up
Whiskey sour.standard garnish: Maraschino cherry and half orange slice
Whiskey sour.preparation: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.
Whiskey sour.ingredients:
4.5 cl (3 parts) bourbon whiskey
3 cl (2 parts) fresh lemon juice
1.5 cl (1 part) simple syrup

Sherry.type: Jerez-Xérès-Sherry DOP in the province of Cádiz in the region of Andalusia

Up to Date.preparation: Add sherry, rye whiskey, mariner, and bitters to a mixing glass with ice. Stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled glass, garnish with a lemon twist.
Up to Date.ingredients:
1.25 oz dry sherry
1.25 oz rye whiskey
0.25 oz Grand Marnier
2 dashes Angostura bitters

Aperol Spritz.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Aperol Spritz.preparation: Build all ingredients into a wine glass filled with ice. Stir gently.
Aperol Spritz.ingredients:
9 cl Prosecco
6 cl Aperol
Splash of soda water

Bellini.preparation: Pour peach purée into chilled glass, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.
Bellini.ingredients:
10 cl (2 parts) Prosecco
5 cl (1 part) fresh peach purée

Hugo.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Hugo.preparation: Stir together over plenty of ice.
Hugo.ingredients:
prosecco
elderflower or lemon balm syrup
seltzer or sparkling water

Buck's Fizz.preparation: Pour the orange juice into glass and top up Champagne. Stir gently, garnish and serve.
Buck's Fizz.ingredients:
5 cl (1 part) orange juice
10 cl (2 parts) Champagne

Champagne Cocktail.preparation: Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.
Champagne Cocktail.ingredients:
9cl Champagne
1cl cognac
2 dashes Angostura bitters
1 sugar cube

Kir Royal.preparation: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up champagne.
Kir Royal.ingredients:
9 cl (3 ounces) (9 parts) champagne
1 cl (0.33 ounce) (1 part) crème de cassis

Mimosa.preparation: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

Kalimotxo.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Kalimotxo.preparation: Stir together over plenty of ice.
Kalimotxo.ingredients:
One part red wine
One part cola or another carbonated soft drink

Mulled wine.alcohol by volume: Mulled wine, steeping with spices and fruit

Tinto de Verano.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Tinto de Verano.ingredients:
One part red wine
One part soft drink

Zurracapote.ingredients:
red wine
fruit (peaches, lemons)
sugar
cinnamon

Kir.preparation: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.
Kir.ingredients:
9 cl (9 parts) white wine
1 cl (1 part) crème de cassis

B-52.primary alcohol by volume:
Coffee liqueur
Irish cream
Orange-flavored liqueur
B-52.preparation: Layer ingredients into a shot glass.  Serve with a stirrer.
B-52.ingredients:
2 cl Kahlúa
2 cl Baileys Irish Cream
2 cl Grand Marnier

Baby Guinness.standard drinkware: 3/4 shot (3 parts) Coffee liqueur, 1/4 shot (1 part) Irish cream
Baby Guinness.preparation: Variation substitutes black Sambuca for coffee liqueur
Baby Guinness.ingredients: Float Irish cream on top of coffee liqueur

Orgasm.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Orgasm.preparation: Build all ingredients over ice in an old fashioned glass or shot glass.
Orgasm.ingredients:
​3⁄4 oz. Vodka*(Back in 1987 in Reno Nevada, *Gmarnier was the liquor, not Vodka)
​3⁄4 oz. Cream
​3⁄4 oz. Kahlúa (Optional if they want a shot of Espresso over ice w/the cream when using Gmarnier)
​3⁄4 oz.Amaretto
​3⁄4 oz. Baileys Irish Cream[1]

Buttery Nipple.preparation: Pour the Sambuca into a shot glass, then pour the Irish Cream on top so that the two liquids do not mix.
Buttery Nipple.ingredients:
(1 part) Sambuca
(1 part) Baileys Irish Cream

Quick Fuck.standard drinkware:
one part Midori liqueur
one part Kahlua
one part Baileys Irish Cream
Quick Fuck.ingredients:
Pour Midori into shot glass.
Carefully add Baileys, letting it float on top.

Slippery Lionel.preparation: Pour the Sambuca into a shot glass, then pour the Irish Cream on top so that the two liquids do not mix.
Slippery Lionel.ingredients:
(1 part) Sambuca
(1 part) Baileys Irish Cream

Springbokkie.preparation: The Crème de menthe is poured into the shot glass and the Amarula is carefully layered on top.
Springbokkie.ingredients:
1cl (1 part) Amarula
3cl (3 parts) Crème de menthe

Grasshopper.primary alcohol by volume:
Crème de cacao
Crème de menthe
Grasshopper.preparation: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Grasshopper.ingredients:
3 cl Crème de menthe (green)
3 cl Crème de cacao (white)
3 cl cream

Golden Doublet.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Golden Doublet.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Golden Dream.preparation: Shake with cracked ice.  Strain into glass and serve.
Golden Dream.ingredients:
2 cl (2 parts) Galliano
2 cl (2 parts) Triple Sec
2 cl (2 parts) Fresh orange juice
1 cl (1 part) Fresh cream

Moonwalk.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Moonwalk.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

Skittle Bomb.type: A pub glass and a shot glass.
Skittle Bomb.ingredients: The Cointreau is poured into a shot glass, and the shot glass is then dropped into the Red Bull.

Japanese Slipper.preparation: Shake together in a mixer with ice.  Strain into glass, garnish and serve.
Japanese Slipper.ingredients:
3 cl (1 part) Midori
3 cl (1 part) cointreau
3 cl (1 part) lemon juice

Alabama Slammer.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Alabama Slammer.standard drinkware:
½ oz. Amaretto
½ oz. Southern Comfort
½ oz. Sloe Gin
fill with orange juice

Godfather.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Godfather.preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Backdraft.preparation: The preparation of this drink is complex, and is explained below.

Carrot Cake.standard drinkware:
one part Baileys Irish Cream
one part Hot Damn Cinnamon Schnapps
one part Frangelico

Common Market.standard drinkware:
3 parts Brandy
2 parts Yellow Chartreuse
1 part Lillet
1 part Orange Juice
1 part Dubonnet
Common Market.ingredients: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

J\u00e4gerbomb.standard drinkware: A pub glass and a shot glass.

Americano.served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Americano.standard garnish: half an orange slice, lemon twist
Americano.preparation: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into a highball glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice and a lemon twist.
Americano.ingredients:
3 cl Campari
3 cl red vermouth
A splash of soda water

Caju Amigo.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Caju Amigo.standard drinkware:
50 ml (1⅔ fl oz) cachaça
½ Lime cut into 4 wedges (or tahiti lime, but not green lemon)
2 teaspoons crystal or refined sugar
Caju Amigo.preparation:
A wide variety of fresh fruits can be used in place of lime. In the absence of cachaça, vodka can be used, making a caipiroska.[4]
If rum is used instead of cachaça it is called a caipiríssima.[5]
Caju Amigo.ingredients: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with crushed ice and add the Cachaça.[3]

Rabo-de-galo.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Rabo-de-galo.standard drinkware:
50 ml (1⅔ fl oz) cachaça
½ Lime cut into 4 wedges (or tahiti lime, but not green lemon)
2 teaspoons crystal or refined sugar
Rabo-de-galo.preparation:
A wide variety of fresh fruits can be used in place of lime. In the absence of cachaça, vodka can be used, making a caipiroska.[4]
If rum is used instead of cachaça it is called a caipiríssima.[5]
Rabo-de-galo.ingredients: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with crushed ice and add the Cachaça.[3]

Polar Bear.served: blended, on the rocks or neat

Redheaded slut.primary alcohol by volume: On the rocks; poured over ice
Redheaded slut.standard drinkware:
5 cl (one part) Jägermeister
5 cl (one part) peach schnapps
cranberry juice
Redheaded slut.preparation: may also be served as a shooter -- chilled and shaken, without ice
Redheaded slut.ingredients: Combine Jägermeister and schnapps in glass full of ice.  Add cranberry juice to fill to top.  Stir as necessary.

Agua loca.standard drinkware: Often served in a punch bowl with punch glasses.
Agua loca.preparation: Varies widely. Many prepared mixes are available.
Agua loca.ingredients: Usually fruit juices and other drink mixers, optionally with alcohol.

Karsk.standard drinkware:
6cl (3 parts) Pure alcohol
6cl (3 parts) Hot coffee
Karsk.ingredients: Heat the coffee; do not boil. Pour into cup and add the alcohol; serve hot.
